Class Subnet

java.lang.Object

extends Object

Represents an internet subnet.

Joerg Rathlev

Method Detail

isValidNetmask

public static boolean isValidNetmask(InetAddress address)
Checks if the given address is a valid netmask.

Parameters:
address - the address to check.
Returns:
true if the address is a netmask, false otherwise.

contains

public boolean contains(InetAddress address)
Returns whether this subnet contains the given address.

Parameters:
address - the address.
Returns:
true if this subnet contains the address, false otherwise.

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of this subnet. The returned string will be in the format address/netmask.

Overrides:
toString in class Object

parseSubnet

public static Subnet parseSubnet(String s)
Parses the given string into a Subnet. The string must be in the form address/netmask.

Parameters:
s - the string.
Returns:
the subnet.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the string is not a valid subnet address.
